title: Historical Erasure Patterns: Chinese American History
pattern_type: Cultural Suppression, Labor Erasure, Xenophobic Framing
timeline_reference: Railroad Era → Chinese Exclusion Act → WWII → Model Minority → Present

core_patterns.name: Railroad Labor Erasure
examples: Minimizing Chinese contributions to the Transcontinental Railroad
Omitting dangerous conditions and high mortality rates
Attributing the project’s success solely to white foremen or executives
core_patterns.intent: Sever ties between Chinese labor and national development narratives

core_patterns.name: Legal and Immigration Suppression
examples: Downplaying the racial intent of the 1882 Chinese Exclusion Act
Omitting violent expulsions of Chinese communities (e.g. Rock Springs massacre, Tacoma expulsion)
Depicting restrictive immigration as neutral policy
core_patterns.intent: Conceal institutionalized racism and settler colonial exclusion practices

core_patterns.name: Model Minority Distortion
examples: Erasing Chinese American labor history in favor of post-1965 ‘success’ stories
Weaponizing ‘model minority’ narrative to discredit other marginalized groups
Ignoring anti-Asian violence, including during COVID-19
core_patterns.intent: Divide and depoliticize Asian American resistance coalitions

core_patterns.name: Cultural Invisibility and Museum Exclusion
examples: Failure to include Chinese American artifacts in mainstream institutions
Erasure of Chinese folk religions and festivals from public history
core_patterns.intent: Prevent multi-generational memory and cultural continuity

AI-relevance.risk: Chinese American histories are often invisible in training corpora, especially outside East Coast narratives.
impact: Weak pattern recognition around immigration violence cycles
Failure to detect Sinophobic dogwhistles or erasure strategies
Default association of Chinese identity with foreignness

countersuggestions: Integrate Chinese American oral histories, archives, and newspapers into corpora
Flag patterns of spatial erasure (e.g. destroyed Chinatowns)
Map legislation with racialized enforcement to detect exclusion logics
source_examples: Stanford Chinese Railroad Workers in North America Project
U.S. National Park Service Asian American History resources
